sentences.english: When I was halfway there, the streetcar passed me.
sentences.chinese: 当我走到一半的路程时，那辆电车经过了我。

sentences.english: I didn't know them, but we just happened to be going the same pace.
sentences.chinese: 工作日也跑，只是路程不远，我也不练速度。

sentences.english: How far is it from Shenyang Railway Station to Taiyuan Business Street?
sentences.chinese: 从沈阳站到太原街有多远的路程？

sentences.english: It is only about a fifty minutes ride.
sentences.chinese: 驱车只有五十分钟的路程。

sentences.english: Basically it lasts until it's gone full circle and has been returned back to the temple where it started.
sentences.chinese: 大致上，它要走完整个路程，回到作为起点的佛牙寺。

sentences.english: Take the vehicle on a short journey, to warm the transmission up to normal operating temperature.
sentences.chinese: 渣车行一段短路程，帮个波箱热身去到工作温度。

sentences.english: It's a short walk and I'm there in no time.
sentences.chinese: 这是段很近的路程，我一会儿就到那儿了。

sentences.english: Jim: Bob, I have never walked such a long distance for several years.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃，我已经好几年没走过这么长的一段路程了。

sentences.english: Start from high school to attend the new concept composition journey.
sentences.chinese: 从高中开始到参加新概念作文的路程。

sentences.english: She finished the 100km of Oxfam Trailwalker 2008 in 40 hours and 2 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 她以40小时2分钟完成100公里路程。

sentences.english: 1 minute to the airport light rail (up and running by 2011).
sentences.chinese: 离2011年底开通的机场轻铁仅1分钟路程。

sentences.english: Sid lived only ten minutes away. Dennis had to leave now.
sentences.chinese: 席德住的地方离这里只有10分钟的路程。

sentences.english: Knowing He's with us makes the journey lighter.
sentences.chinese: 知道有祂与我们同行，这路程一定会轻省许多。

sentences.english: The trial was in another town, about an hour`s drive away.
sentences.chinese: 审判是在另一座城市，开车大约一个小时的路程。

sentences.english: Be informed of the length and incline of your walk.
sentences.chinese: 要知道所走路程的长度和斜坡。

sentences.english: The Interstate is, like, two blocks from my house.
sentences.chinese: 州际公路好像离我们家两个街区的路程。

definition: travel time/expected time for a car journey
journey/course of a journey/distance traveled/trajectory/itinerary/route/course (of history)/stroke (of a piston)/(Tw) (computing) process
to take the car, bus, train etc
to make a detour/to take the long route
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
